byline.contributor: Chris Buckley contributed reporting from Katmandu, Nepal, and Nida Najar and Suhasini Raj from New Delhi.

abstract: Destruction and suffering wrought by powerful earthquake in Nepal have been exacerbated by nation's endemic political and economic problems; survivors cite nation's tolerance of poor construction and development norms, its shoddy infrastructure and other factors that made it far more vulnerable to quake; natural disaster, compounding dire economic situation, has led to atmosphere of despair.
lead_paragraph: Nepal was in political and economic disarray well before a powerful earthquake on Saturday shattered buildings, and lives.

headline.main: In an Already Troubled Nepal, a Picture of Despair Emerges
headline.print_headline: In an Already Troubled Nepal, a Picture of Despair Emerges

snippet: Nepal was in political and economic disarray well before a powerful earthquake on Saturday shattered buildings, and lives.
